name: io.bytes.per.checksum
description:
The number of bytes per checksum.  Must not be larger than
  io.file.buffer.size.

name: dfs.client.retry.times.get-last-block-length
description: Number of retries for calls to fetchLocatedBlocksAndGetLastBlockLength().

name: dfs.namenode.lease-recheck-interval-ms
description:
During the release of lease a lock is hold that make any
    operations on the namenode stuck. In order to not block them during
    a too long duration we stop releasing lease after this max lock limit.

name: dfs.datanode.directoryscan.threads
description:
How many threads should the threadpool used to compile reports
  for volumes in parallel have.

name: dfs.client.slow.io.warning.threshold.ms
description:
The threshold in milliseconds at which we will log a slow
    io warning in a dfsclient. By default, this parameter is set to 30000
    milliseconds (30 seconds).

name: ha.failover-controller.graceful-fence.rpc-timeout.ms
description: Timeout that the FC waits for the old active to go to standby

name: dfs.disk.balancer.max.disk.throughputInMBperSec
description:
Maximum disk bandwidth used by diskbalancer
      during read from a source disk. The unit is MB/sec.

name: dfs.datanode.peer.metrics.min.outlier.detection.samples
description:
Minimum number of packet send samples which are required to qualify for outlier detection.
      If the number of samples is below this then outlier detection is skipped.

name: dfs.ha.tail-edits.period.backoff-max
description:
The maximum time the tailer should wait between checking for new edit log
    entries. Exponential backoff will be applied when an edit log tail is
    performed but no edits are available to be read. Values less than or
    equal to zero disable backoff entirely; this is the default behavior.
    Supports multiple time unit suffix (case insensitive), as described
    in dfs.heartbeat.interval.

name: dfs.qjournal.get-journal-state.timeout.ms
description:
Timeout in milliseconds when calling getJournalState().
    JournalNodes.
